p.4: A major health system in the US is seeking a data scientist to help lead projects across healthcare, human resources, financial, and supply chain analytics.

li: Develop and apply computational algorithms and statistical methods to healthcare data (including data from EMRs, financial management, human resource, quality, supply chain, etc)
li.1: Develop and deploy healthcare-relevant predictive and prescriptive models

strong: A successful Data Scientist will likely have the following skills and experience:

li: Master's degree in Public Health, Health Care Research, Epidemiology, Statistics, Data Science, Health Policy, Economics, Finance, Simulation/Simulation-Based Optimization, or related field
li.1: Strong knowledge of EMR data, clinical data, claims data, or financial data
li.3: Experience with Cloud-based data and AI solutions
li.4: Hands-on experience with a broad range of deep learning tools (e.g., TensorFlow, Spark, Theano, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, Keras, Caffe, Nvidia Digits) and collaboration environments (e.g. Jupyter notebooks, PyCharm, gitlab, github)
li.5: Strong problem-solving and organizational skills, an orientation toward detail, and collaboration oriented
li.6: Present complex data to both technical and non-technical audiences

p.14: A competitive base salary of $120,000-$140,000 +bonus + benefits
